low.question: What is an area code in telephone numbering?
options: A three-digit code designating a geographic calling region
A two-digit country identifier for international calls
A sequence that routes calls to voicemail systems
low.answer: A three-digit code designating a geographic calling region

low.question: Which symbol commonly indicates an international telephone prefix on phones?
Which country uses the country calling code +1?
options: United States and other NANP countries
low.answer: United States and other NANP countries

low.question: Which country calling code belongs to the United Kingdom?
Which country uses country code +91?
Which three-digit area code is famously associated with Manhattan, New York?
What is the typical US emergency telephone number?
Which area code is commonly associated with San Francisco, California?
Which country calling code is assigned to Japan?
What type of service typically uses the 800 area code in North America?
Which country uses the country calling code +86?
What does the abbreviation NANP stand for?
Which country calling code is assigned to Australia?
What is the international dialing prefix used when calling from the United States?
Which two countries share the country calling code +7?
Which country uses the calling code +49?
What does a toll-free telephone number mean for the caller?
options: The caller is not charged for the call
The caller pays a premium per minute
The caller must use a specific carrier
low.answer: The caller is not charged for the call

low.question: Which area code is traditionally associated with Los Angeles, California?
Which country uses the calling code +52?
What does the term "overlay" mean regarding area codes?
options: Multiple area codes serve the same geographic region
An area code that covers an entire country
An area code reserved only for mobile phones
low.answer: Multiple area codes serve the same geographic region

low.question: Which area code is associated with Washington, D.C.?
Which country uses the country calling code +33?
Which prefix often indicates a premium-rate telephone service in North America?
What does a country calling code identify in international dialing?
options: The country or region of the destination number
The local area within a city
low.answer: The country or region of the destination number

low.question: Which country uses calling code +39?
Which symbol should you press to replace the international dialing prefix on a mobile phone?
Which country uses the calling code +380?
Which area code is strongly associated with downtown Chicago, Illinois?
What is a vanity phone number?
options: A number that spells a word or brand name
A number reserved for government use
low.answer: A number that spells a word or brand name

medium.question: What is the standard maximum length for international telephone numbers under E.164?
In the NANP, what does NPA commonly refer to?
Which digit range is allowed for the first digit of a NANP area code?
Which organization assigns international country calling codes?
What is number portability in telephony?
options: Ability to keep a phone number when changing carriers
Ability to forward calls internationally for free
Ability to change an area code automatically
medium.answer: Ability to keep a phone number when changing carriers

medium.question: Which of these is a North American toll-free area code?
What does the NXX pattern represent in NANP structure?
options: Exchange code digits following the area code
Country code followed by area code
medium.answer: Exchange code digits following the area code

medium.question: Which common international dialing prefix is used across many countries?
What triggered widespread adoption of area code overlays in the 1990s and 2000s?
options: Rapid growth in mobile and data lines exhausting numbers
Government mandates to reduce call costs
medium.answer: Rapid growth in mobile and data lines exhausting numbers

medium.question: What does LRN stand for in number portability systems?
Which of these area codes was part of the original 1947 NANP assignments?
Which prefix sequence often indicates an international direct dial from mobile phones worldwide?
What is an overlay plan for area codes?
options: Introducing a new area code that covers the same geographic area
Splitting a region into two separate area codes
Merging adjacent area codes into one
medium.answer: Introducing a new area code that covers the same geographic area

medium.question: Which NANP restriction applies to the N (first) digit of central office codes (NXX)?
Which North American area code was originally assigned to nearly all of California's Bay Area?
Which of these is a premium-rate prefix in North America?
Which country uses the international dialing code +351?
What term describes the practice of dividing one area code region into two or more codes?
Which database stores routing information for ported numbers in North America?
Which area code is associated with Miami, Florida?
Which of these is a common reason a region moves to mandatory ten-digit dialing?
options: Introduction of an overlay area code
Spin-off of the original area code
medium.answer: Introduction of an overlay area code

medium.question: Which country code belongs to Brazil?
Which area code is commonly associated with downtown Boston, Massachusetts?
What is number pooling in telephone number management?
options: Allocating blocks of numbers in smaller increments to carriers
Merging carriers’ number ranges into one pool
Sharing a single area code among multiple countries
medium.answer: Allocating blocks of numbers in smaller increments to carriers

medium.question: Which country uses the calling code +358?
What feature allows a toll-free number to route calls based on caller location and time?
Which area code covers central Philadelphia, Pennsylvania?
Which country uses prefix +27 for international calls?
What does the E.164 recommendation primarily specify?
options: International telephone number format and length
medium.answer: International telephone number format and length

hard.question: In the original 1947 NANP design, what did a middle digit of 0 indicate for an area code?
options: The area code covered an entire state or province
The area code was reserved for mobile services
The area code was for toll-free numbers
hard.answer: The area code covered an entire state or province

hard.question: Which two-digit pattern was forbidden in the first digit of a NANP NPA historically?

Which country shares the +290 country code?
options: Saint Helena, Ascension and Tristan da Cunha
hard.answer: Saint Helena, Ascension and Tristan da Cunha

hard.question: What does the acronym NPAC specifically manage in North America?
options: The database supporting number portability routing
hard.answer: The database supporting number portability routing

hard.question: Which New York City area code was introduced specifically to serve mobile phones across boroughs?
Which ITU recommendation defines country calling codes and number structure?
What is an LRN used for when routing a ported telephone number?
options: It identifies the switch that currently serves the ported number
It authenticates subscriber identity for secure calls
It denotes the subscriber's billing account number
hard.answer: It identifies the switch that currently serves the ported number

hard.question: Which country uses the unusual country code +388 previously assigned for a European experiment?
options: It was a European Union shared code for cross-border services
hard.answer: It was a European Union shared code for cross-border services

options: To make numbers memorable by spelling words on the keypad
To encrypt subscriber identity on public networks
hard.answer: To make numbers memorable by spelling words on the keypad

options: Any area code with overlapping 10-digit conflicts implemented 988
hard.answer: Any area code with overlapping 10-digit conflicts implemented 988

options: Allocation of prefixes to carriers without pooling
hard.answer: Allocation of prefixes to carriers without pooling

options: Implementing number conservation measures like pooling
hard.answer: Implementing number conservation measures like pooling

options: Mandatory ten-digit dialing and updated printed materials
Conversion of mobile numbers to landline format
hard.answer: Mandatory ten-digit dialing and updated printed materials

options: Toll-free number translation and advanced routing
hard.answer: Toll-free number translation and advanced routing
